page.title: 08Customs in Cullyhanna.
page.content: There are many local customs in this area which the people hold on to and are proud of.The most popular one is the making of the St. Brigid crosses for 1st February,her feast day.St Brigid was born at Faughart,near Dundalk,about 10 miles from here.Rushes are gathered in the fields and woven by hand into the shape of a cross.These are blessed and hung in the homes.Farmers hang them in their outhouses and sheds to protect their property and stock.It is customary for people to visit the graves of their relatives and friends every Sunday and once a year the graves are blessed during a special ceremony.There is a Parish Mission every three years.Visiting priests come for a week,say two Masses each morning,visit the sick and have Devotions in the evening.Everyone attends the Mission.
